Title: CAF Champions League 2025/26: Remo Stars, Rivers United set to represent Nigeria
Summary: Remo Stars and Rivers United are poised to represent Nigeria in the 2025/2026 CAF Champions League . Nigeria, ranked among the top 12 African footballing clubs, are set to represent the country .

Title: Police intercept firearms trafficked from Benue to Ilorin in Nasarawa
Summary: Police intercept firearms trafficked from Benue to Ilorin in Nasarawa State . There are indications that armed herdsmen wreaking havoc on locals in Benue communities are beginning to attack locals .

Title: CDHR wades into MINILS crises, sues for peace
Summary: The Committee for the Defence of Human Rights (CDHR) wades into MINILS crises, sues for peace . Issa Aremu is the Director General of Michael Imoudu National Institute for Labour Studies (MINILS) in Ilorin, Kwara State .

Title: 100 dead cats found at Japanese woman’s house
Summary: Around 100 dead cats were discovered at the squalid home of a woman in southwest Japan . The group, Animal Assist Senju, apologised on social media, posting pictures .

Title: Four I.Coast opposition figures barred from October presidential vote
Summary: Four prominent opposition figures in Ivory Coast have been excluded from the final voter list and are ineligible to contest the October presidential election . Tidjane Thiam, the leader of Ivory Coast’s main opposition party, the party's leader, the electoral commission announced Wednesday .

Title: Saudi authorities ban political, sectarian expressions at Hajj sites
Summary: Saudi Arabia’s Ministry of Interior has announced a strict ban on taking photographs or videos or raising political and sectarian expressions at main Hajj sites .

Title: Man City agree fee with AC Milan for midfielder Reijnders
Summary: Manchester City agree fee with AC Milan for Dutch midfielder Tijjani Reijnders . Dutch midfielder is City's first major signing of the summer transfer window .

Title: DSS prays court to bar Utomi, associates from holding rallies
Summary: Department of State Services (DSS) filed a fresh application against Prof. Pat Utomi at the Federal High Court in Abuja . The application was filed through its lawyer, Akinlolu Kehinde, SAN, before Justice Justice Ogunlesi .

Title: ‘Disgusting abomination’ – Elon Musk blasts federal spending under Trump
Summary: Musk’s comments came just one day before he stepped down as head of the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) after four months .

Title: APC members ask Tinubu to intervene in Nsukka marginalization in Enugu
Summary: Members of APC in Enugu North Senatorial district have urged President Bola Tinubu to intervene in their alleged marginalization in the party . The party members alleged that they have been schemed out in most appointments, excommunicated in critical decisions .

Title: Police arrest car snatcher with seven master keys in Rivers
Summary: The Rivers State Police Command has announced the arrest of a suspected car snatcher, Felix Clark, along Abacha Road in the GRA axis of Port Harcourt . The police reported that the suspect was intercepted while riding a bicycle during a routine patrol . Title: Babcock varsity dismisses student over 'fetish practices,' drug peddling
Summary: Babcock University, Ilishan-Remo, Ogun State, has dismissed a student, Oladipupo Siwajuola, over what it described as “gross violation of university rules,” including involvement in fetish practices, drug peddling, impersonation, and dishonesty . Sodiq�

Title: Ex-Abia AG denies forgery complaint against lawyer
Summary: In a formal letter dated May 30 and addressed to the Inspector General of Police, Kayode Egbetokun, Chief Awa Kalu, SAN, has denied initiating any police complaint against Victor Giwa . Giwa was alleged to have forged a legal document purportedly issued by the chambers of Kalu to communicate with the Attorney General of

Title: Nigeria's military to shift from foreign to local equipment — Minister
Summary: The Minister of Defence, Badaru Abubakar, has revealed that Nigeria is moving from dependence on foreign military procurement to local production . Badaru made this known shortly after concluding his 2-day working tour of military institutions and facilities in Kaduna .

Title: ‘Our reports evidence-based, not biased,’ Amnesty International tells Northern clerics, influencers
Summary: Amnesty International has responded to claims by some Northern clerics and influencers of selective and biased reporting of the killings in the North .
